Posted By: Lord_of_Tresserhorn (9/17/2013 3:51:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
About the Gods, there's just this one thing I need to say.  
  
During the pre-release just a day ago, I got this chick, her bow, and Thassa. Now that looked facking sweet, I was obviously playing UB. And so, in one of the matches, I actually got all these cards out on the board, and guess what? I lost really hard. Because even though that scry 1 was really nice, and being able to give myself 3 life each turn was decent; If you don't get something to back these dudes up it's over. The Gods and their weapons are powerful, but not on their own. And it really showed. I got smashed several times by minotaurs and giant foxes, even though I had Legendary Mythics on the board and they only had commons.  
  
And that makes me very happy.
posts.html:
About the Gods, there's just this one thing I need to say.

During the pre-release just a day ago, I got this chick, her bow, and Thassa. Now that looked facking sweet, I was obviously playing UB. And so, in one of the matches, I actually got all these cards out on the board, and guess what? I lost really hard. Because even though that scry 1 was really nice, and being able to give myself 3 life each turn was decent; If you don't get something to back these dudes up it's over. The Gods and their weapons are powerful, but not on their own. And it really showed. I got smashed several times by minotaurs and giant foxes, even though I had Legendary Mythics on the board and they only had commons.

And that makes me very happy.

Posted By: anotherfan321 (9/17/2013 7:41:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She may appear weaker than a lot of the Gods. But she gives a ramp deck a lot to do with its spare mana and with [burning-tree emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=burning-tree emissary) in standard? Here's a turn 4 with her for you: attack with 4/4 [experiment one](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=experiment one), 2/2 emissary, 3/1 [brushstrider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=brushstrider) and 4/3 [Renegade Krasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Renegade Krasis) all with trample. Not even removing the emissary or Krasis will stop Nylea from being an indestructible 6/6 clogging up the ground.  
  
That's just one curve aiming for turn 4. [Elvish mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish mystic), Emissary, [Domri Rade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Domri Rade), Nylea.  
Experiment 1, Emissary, [Sylvan Caryatid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Caryatid), another turn 3 Nylea.  
Mystic, Emissary, [Bow of Nylea](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bow of Nylea), Nylea herself.  
[Sedge scorpion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sedge scorpion), [Satyr Hedonist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Satyr Hedonist), the bow, [Xenagos, the reveler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Xenagos, the reveler), turn 4 Nylea with style.  
  
Purphoros can also play with Emissaries, but Nylea doesn't need to go into another ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: HotHit (9/22/2013 1:52:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As usual, Green gets the shaft on the surface, though I think there's more to be said for an easily-played Indestructible 6/6 that gives the dorks you used to make her a creature trample. The pump ability is pathetic, but she's an effective whupstick.   
  
Still not terribly impressive though. Let me remind you all that this character is a FRIGGING **GOD**. Not an angel surrogate who gets stuck in a moon-chunk for 2/3s of the block, not a demon masquerading, not a Nephelim, and not some sort of flying pasta mountain. Capital-letter GOD. I really wasn't impressed with the cycle overall, and Nylea is emblematic of the issue:  
  
They wanted the Gods to be playable. So they couldn't make them have huge mana costs and jaw-dropping abilities. I think it was a mistake to not make the God cycle we've seen at this point eye-popping with unique, never-before-seen abilities. Not necessarily overpowered Baneslayer garbage, but I mean things that did something genuinely new.   
  
I mean, Nylea's a hunt ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Lord_of_phyrexia (10/2/2013 2:29:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Works great along with her blandly named weapon of choice, [Bow of Nylea](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bow of Nylea). Green shouldn't have any problem getting a measly five green mana icons on the board.  
  
Definitely going to replace [Primal Rage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Rage) in my EDH decks, but I think I'll keep [Brawn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brawn) still.  
  
The god cards are going to warp EDH a bit. They're sure to be popular. There's five already, with ten more to come. Dealing with Indestructible Enchantment/Creature things is going to require effects like, for example, [Sever The Bloodline](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sever The Bloodline), [Ashes to Ashes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashes to Ashes), [Tragic Slip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tragic Slip), [Swords To Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords To Plowshares), [Dispatch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dispatch), [Erase](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Erase), [Fade into Antiquity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fade into Antiquity), [Karn Liberated](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn Liberated), [Duplicant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duplicant), or [Legacy Weapon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Legacy Weapon).
posts.html:
Works great along with her blandly named weapon of choice, Bow of Nylea. Green shouldn't have any problem getting a measly five green mana icons on the board.

Definitely going to replace Primal Rage in my EDH decks, but I think I'll keep Brawn still.

The god cards are going to warp EDH a bit. They're sure to be popular. There's five already, with ten more to come. Dealing with Indestructible Enchantment/Creature things is going to require effects like, for example, Sever The Bloodline, Ashes to Ashes, Tragic Slip, Swords To Plowshares, Dispatch, Erase, Fade into Antiquity, Karn Liberated, Duplicant, or Legacy Weapon.
